item.title: Analytics Lead
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Lead

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture/Enterprise Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members.

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.
  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must have

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Data Science, Consulting).
  • Fluent in SQL (for analyses & creating reports) and predictive analytics in R or Python. 
  • Experience communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.
  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners.
  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in improving business processes using ML is a big plus.
  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a plus.
  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

RBC Ventures

item.title: Senior Manager, HEF Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, HEF Analytics

Job Description

Advanced Analytics – including Predictive Modeling

  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support the leadership group in active management of the Home Equity portfolio.
  • Provide tactical backing to stakeholders by leading/participating in deep-dive analyses required to better understand key objectives and opportunities.
  • Proactively identify areas of improvement for the HEF portfolio in order to drive the following: incremental balance growth, revenue prospects, and areas creating synergy and optimizing overall costs.
  • Work collaboratively and advise on business decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies.
  • Develop and maintain report-backs on success of initiatives with regular cadence to ensure effective monitoring of expected outcomes. Communicate results to key stakeholders and ensure insights are managed to optimize future activities.
  • Participate in high-priority initiatives required to support the HEF and PFP senior management teams.

Big Data Visualization & Infrastructure

  • Support the development of future-state tools and capabilities to drive value-added insights and transparency for users across the organization.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, identify possible synergies with other reports across HEF/PFP, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes, and expose timely and relevant information to end-users.
  • Collaborate with partners across RBC to identify new sources of information in order to augment current data elements and provide more in depth insights into profile & behaviour of clients.
  • Maintain existing data visualization framework by ensuring accurate and timely updates, optimize the tool performance to reduce lag/down times, and maintenance of user group(s) to ensure compliance with governance and code of conduct standards.
  • Enable capability to drive reporting of data visualization tool usage and ongoing report backs to provide an assessment of user needs.
  • Proactively research, and identify, new tools and capabilities in order to maintain market leading position on optimization of analytical, lead management and reporting activity.

Portfolio Management & Reporting

  • Deliver regular updates on the Monthly Business Review (MBR) providing key business intelligence to the Home Equity Finance leadership team and supporting partners.
  • Update market share results on a monthly basis, providing a granular view into the performance of RBC against its peers, while looking to continuously improve existing capabilities.
  • Support the development, and ongoing update, to the Quarterly Competitive analysis shared with senior executives across HEF and members of the Canadian Banking Operating Committee.
  • Support data aggregation from analyst calls of major banks in Canada, and highlight key insights as it pertains to their respective Real Estate Secured Lending (RESL) portfolios. Report is aimed to help Senior Management identify key opportunities and if a change in the strategy is required to ensure HEF is able to reach its annual targets.
  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of the HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Collaborate with partners across RBC to ensure data quality and integrity.

Mentoring & Coaching

  • Provide ongoing mentoring and coaching to colleagues across the Portfolio Management team.

Advanced Analytics – 45%

Big Data Visualization & Infrastructure – 30%

Portfolio Management & Reporting – 20%

Mentoring & Coaching – 5%

Job Summary

The Senior Manager, HEF Portfolio Management will play an integral role and is responsible for bringing HEF into the forefront of advanced analytics and data visualization tactics. The incumbent will primarily support the Portfolio Management team, while also working with other members of the broader HEF team to deliver on key analytical priorities. The role will leverage data-driven tactics to deliver insights that will enable better understanding of client behaviour and trends to formulate strategies for business optimization, financial performance management, product and customer profitability, key segment understanding, retention/acquisition programs, targeted marketing, competitive intelligence/research, innovation and leading edge tools and practices. Furthermore, the incumbent will maintain ongoing reporting of the HEF portfolio and competitive landscape, providing key insights to the HEF senior leadership teams and key stakeholders.

item.title: Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will have the opportunity to apply analytics to the point of client interaction with the Digital Products of RBC.  You will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle: data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations. 

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure and complete analyses, uncover insights, develop net new data assets, and build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years of experience in related digital product development, data analyst or data mining role
  • Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm for advancing digital analytics and products
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala and PowerPoint
  • Experience with Jupyter Notebooks, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau or comparable data visualization tools
  • Hands-on knowledge of agile methodologies Github and JIRA
  • Structured thinking: developing an end-to-end analysis plans to tackle ambiguous and open-ended business problems
  • Stakeholder management skills: ability to inform and influence stakeholders through data, build relationships, communicate early and often
  • High agency: figuring out a way to get the job done, pushing through in the face of imperfect conditions or managing to reverse adverse conditions to achieve goals

Nice-to-have

  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Design, oversee and deliver analytics on client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use data mining and a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights
    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support product development strategies and drive decisions
    • Help implement re-usable analytics frameworks for use across Digital data
  • Data Collection/ Ingestions/ Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
  • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
  • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities
  • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Actively support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Manage stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with progress on deliverables
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition

    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

CFG Sales Strategy and Analytics

Job Description

  • Assist with the development and implementation of customer account plans and strategies

  • Assist with implementing best practices to support consistent, consultative sales and client success processes
  • Assist with monitoring KPIs and sales metrics
  • Collaborate with business management, technology, finance, data management teams to develop bespoke reporting and dashboards
  • Gather data quickly and respond in oral and written format to senior sales people and client info requests

Job Summary

Support the Central Funding sales organization across client facing verticals and work in partnership with Capital Markets businesses and Functions to achieve our strategic objectives. RBC Capital Market’s Central Funding Group (“CFG”) operates a global secured finance business providing short-term funding secured by collateral - typically fixed income and equity securities.

The role covers a broad range of activities/ responsibilities to support senior sales efforts, including the production of marketing material, preparing material for client meetings (internal and external), developing account plans and tracking follow ups to ensure client success.

item.title: Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing and financial modelling
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies and playbooks
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in a Finance role (Corporate Treasury, Funds Transfer Pricing)
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity models

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Pricing and Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and management of pricing strategies to drive profitable growth and increased market share for the Personal Lending (PL) portfolios. item.title: Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics

Job Description

  • Define testing scope and methodology using a risk-based approach against data sets/portfolios, data sources/systems, reporting elements, and data infrastructure components
  • Engage with stakeholders to gather information required in defining testing cycles and engagement model 
  • Create repeatable documented test scripts and maintain them accordingly
  • Define data testing automation requirements and engage with technology partners for tool selection and use
  • Document data testing procedures and controls including identifying the entrance and exit criteria of key processes and classifying risk and controls accordingly as well as reporting self-identified findings and remediating them
  • Execute data testing procedures and test scripts including identifying root cause of issues and grouping them into themes
  • Produce test results memo including clearly articulating test results, summarizing key findings and issues and communicate the data testing story to stakeholders
  • Engage stakeholders to solicit their remediation plans and validate that remediation plans are sustainable
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve and optimize the data quality assurance processes including recommending analytical tools and training courses
  • Contributes content for the development of training materials
  • Conduct knowledge sharing sessions amongst staff within the Enterprise Chief Data Office and participate in key events and meetings
  • Promote the value of data quality assurance & analytics services to key stakeholders across the bank and establish strong and trusted relationships
  • Prepare and contribute materials required for regulatory and internal audit exams as required
  • Escalate operational risks and issues and control deficiencies that you identify in your line of work to your line manager on a timely basis

Job Summary

•The Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics is responsible for conducting the independent validation over the accuracy and integrity of data throughout the data supply chain that supports the firm’s key business processes such as regulatory reporting and critical management reporting. This entails performing data analysis and transaction testing using analytical tools to address key risks associated with the data sets and data infrastructure.

•The Senior Manager position is an individual contributor role within the Data Quality Assurance & Analytics function of the Enterprise Data Governance Operations (EDGO) of the Chief Data Office (CDO). The EDGO functions as a ‘Second Line of Defense’ within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model, accountable for managing the firm’s information management risk in support of RBC’s operational risk management objectives. The Senior Manager position reports to the Director of Data Quality Assurance & Analytics.

item.title: Associate Director, Capital Analytics, Optimization and Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Capital Analytics, Optimization and Reporting

Job Description

Capital Analytics:

  • Assesses the impacts of business strategies and transactions, capital actions and future regulatory and accounting changes on RBC’s consolidated regulatory capital position and related KPIs, as well as impacts on individual products, platforms, and subsidiaries
  • Analyzes and responds to periodic and/or ad-hoc requests, reports and reviews requested by management, regulators and businesses
  • Maintains robust and up-to-date playbook and impact assessment of stress testing and Recovery and Resolution Plan management actions
  • Leads the preparation, estimation, forecasting and benchmarking of RBC’s G-SIB score and drivers

Capital Optimization:

  • Maintains an up-to-date tracker of completed and prospective capital optimization initiatives
  • Collaborates with various stakeholders in FRO and Group Risk Management to ensure timely and effective implementation of optimization initiatives
  • Coordinates continuous analytics to identify RWA optimization opportunities to build our optimization pipeline and ensure capital efficiency. This involves analyzing data and rules, with technical support from the capital measurement, product leads and business solutions teams
  • Provides technical support and guidance to internal stakeholders on capital optimization initiatives in partnership with capital measurement team and parameter estimation team in Group Risk Management

Management Reporting:

  • Leads the preparation, production and review of periodic capital analytics and benchmarking reports (Pillar 3, G-SIB, Capital Metrics, etc.).
  • Leads the development, implementation and maintenance of effective controls over management reports to ensure accuracy
  • Liaises with stakeholders regarding data quality, reporting inquiries and drivers
  • Assists in the preparation and review of RBC Pillar III benchmarking report
  • Identifies opportunities to improve processes, drive efficiencies and enhance internal controls
  • Participates in initiatives impacting capital position and regulatory filings

Must-have:

  • Bachelor’s degree or greater (e.g. Business, Accounting, etc.)  Accounting designation such as CPA (CA) and/or CFA, FRM
  • 2+ years progressive experience in a related field
  • Excellent research and analytical skills
  • Advanced skills in spreadsheet design and building presentations
  • Proven strong ability to work across business platforms
  • Data visualization skills

Job Summary

The Associate Director – Capital Analytics, Optimization and Reporting within RBC’s Financial Resource Optimization (FRO) group:

1. Delivers impactful insights on the Bank’s capital and related ratios, metrics and KPIs
2. Performs and communicates quantitative analyses related to capital implications of business strategies, transactions, capital initiatives, stress testing, financial crisis plans, and regulatory and accounting changes
3. Maintains capital optimization initiatives pipeline and executes on the initiatives in collaboration with various stakeholders across the Bank
4. Prepares monthly and quarterly performance metrics and benchmarking reports

This position’s deliverables have high visibility with senior executives. They also form the basis for proactive decision-making related to the Bank’s capital activities

item.title: Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

In this role as a Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics, you will leverage analytics skills, design and implement data science solutions to solve a broad range of marketing business use cases related to marketing spend optimization. By collaborating with business, marketing, analytics & technology partners, you will take full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights and opportunities that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Our vision is to improve the way we measure marketing investments, and to help the organization evolve the decisioning and planning strategy for marketing mix.

What will you do?

  • Develop RBC Marketing Mix Modelling strategy, scaling resources, tools, and processes to provide solutions that align to business needs that are actionable with a tangible outcome. Work closely with key marketing and business partners and influence key stakeholders.
  • Collect and validate data from various sources, and prepare structured/non-structured data for modelling by cleaning, integrating and transforming large datasets
  • Develop and deploy statistical and machine learning models using Python and R
  • Translate model outputs and leverage visualization tools/packages to story-tell and convey data-driven insights with actionable recommendations to key stakeholders
  • Research, explore, and prototype future non-standard analytics approaches that push the current limits by quickly learning emerging methods/tools from research communities and further exploring public and vendor data

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or other quantitative discipline
  • 3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive analytics and statistical modelling with a focus on driving business impact
  • Strong Python/R skills for model preparation and development
  • Proficiency with SQL is required and experience working with cloud environments would be a plus
  • Familiarity with scenario planning for optimization or forecasting
  • Experience of visualizing and presenting data and analytics findings to executives
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and communication skills
  • Self-motivation, creativity and ability to work independently


 

Nice to have:

  • Previous experience with marketing and media analytics, including attribution and marketing mix modelling
  • Familiarity with marketing metrics and analyzing data for digital marketing as well as all other non-digital channel marketing
  • Experience working in financial industry with understanding of bank products and data
  • Experience with natural language processing / text mining or competitive market analysis

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Manager, HEF Data Analytics - 16 Months Contract
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, HEF Data Analytics - 16 Months Contract

Job Description

Big Data Visualization & Infrastructure

  • Support the development of future-state tools and capabilities to drive value-added insights and transparency for users across the organization.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, identify possible synergies with other reports across HEF/PFP, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes, and expose timely and relevant information to end-users.
  • Collaborate with partners across RBC to identify new sources of information in order to augment current data elements and provide more in depth insights into profile & behaviour of clients.
  • Maintain existing data visualization framework by ensuring accurate and timely updates, optimize the tool performance to reduce lag/down times, and maintenance of user group(s) to ensure compliance with governance and code of conduct standards.
  • Enable capability to drive reporting of data visualization tool usage and ongoing report backs to provide an assessment of user needs.
  • Proactively research, and identify, new tools and capabilities in order to maintain market leading position on optimization of analytical, lead management and reporting activity.

Portfolio Management & Reporting

  • Deliver regular updates on the Monthly Business Review (MBR) providing key business intelligence to the Home Equity Finance leadership team and supporting partners.
  • Update market share results on a monthly basis, providing a granular view into the performance of RBC against its peers, while looking to continuously improve existing capabilities.
  • Support the development, and ongoing update, to the Quarterly Competitive analysis shared with senior executives across HEF and members of the Canadian Banking Operating Committee.
  • Support data aggregation from analyst calls of major banks in Canada, and highlight key insights as it pertains to their respective Real Estate Secured Lending (RESL) portfolios. Report is aimed to help Senior Management identify key opportunities and if a change in the strategy is required to ensure HEF is able to reach its annual targets.
  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of the HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Collaborate with partners across RBC to ensure data quality and integrity.

Advanced Analytics – including Predictive Modeling

  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support the leadership group in active management of the Home Equity portfolio.
  • Provide tactical backing to stakeholders by leading/participating in deep-dive analyses required to better understand key objectives and opportunities.
  • Proactively identify areas of improvement for the HEF portfolio in order to drive the following: incremental balance growth, revenue prospects, and areas creating synergy and optimizing overall costs.
  • Work collaboratively and advise on business decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies.
  • Develop and maintain report-backs on success of initiatives with regular cadence to ensure effective monitoring of expected outcomes. Communicate results to key stakeholders and ensure insights are managed to optimize future activities.

  • Participate in high-priority initiatives required to support the HEF and PFP senior management teams.

Big Data Visualization & Infrastructure – 40%

Portfolio Management & Reporting – 40%

Advanced Analytics – 20%

Job Summary

The Manager, HEF Portfolio Management will play an integral role and is responsible for bringing HEF into the forefront of advanced analytics and data visualization tactics. The incumbent will primarily support the Portfolio Management team, while also working with other members of the broader HEF team to deliver on key analytical priorities. The role will leverage data-driven tactics to deliver insights that will enable better understanding of client behaviour and trends to formulate strategies for business optimization, financial performance management, product and customer profitability, key segment understanding, retention/acquisition programs, targeted marketing, competitive intelligence/research, innovation and leading edge tools and practices. Furthermore, the incumbent will maintain ongoing reporting of the HEF portfolio and competitive landscape, providing key insights to the HEF senior leadership teams and key stakeholders.

item.title: Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.
  • Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.
  • Commitment to winning as a team.
  • An entrepreneurial & innovative spirit

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub
  • Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and Metabase

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

 Launching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.

 

We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.

 

VSPRODUCT

RBC Ventures

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Opportunity to drive the vision and lead two growing and successful Data Service products: Galileo and PATH. 

Galileo is a self-serve, one-stop "Storefront" to empower the organization with access to data, tools and processes without the dependency on heavy IT support/involvement.  PATH is a journey analytics platform that connects data points across systems and channels to uncover opportunities to improve client experience and operational efficiency.

What will you do?

  • Drive long term product vision, strategy, value proposition and roadmap priorities to create best in class products.

  • As the voice of the customer and expert on the competition, identify and prioritize feature development (positioning of new capabilities) with an enterprise/ reuse/ innovation and business value perspective. 

  • “Product evangelist” to the product team, business partners and executives. You are accountable for creating and telling the product story so that it is understood by a variety of audiences and generates demand/ adoption.

  • Create documentation / collateral for effective communication with partners and executives. Provide updates and supporting materials for key meetings and presentations on progress.

  • Establish and deliver ongoing metrics related to adoption, usage and enabled value.

  • Work closely with our business development team, business partners, product owners (delivery leads) to identify opportunities, prioritize feature development, and provide  transparency of roadmaps

  • Collaborate with Architecture and product teams to ensure product architecture/ design principles/ standards are in place to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s).

  • Collaborate with user experience and design specialists

  • Collaborate with Architecture/ product teams/ user experience and design specialists to ensure product architecture/ design principles/ standards are in place to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s) while ensuring easy access and ease of use.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 10+ years proven track record of leading/ launching software products or programs.

  • Domain expertise (analytics platforms, hands-on data experience) and a passion for technology/data, technical acumen and a customer focused mindset

  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to connect the dots across business opportunities.

  • Strong prioritization and collaboration skills with experience working in an Agile environment

  • Undergrad degree

Nice-to-have

  • Graduate degree

  • Financial Services  Industry experience

  • Knowledge of Jira/ Confluence

What’s in it for you?

item.title: Associate - Market Data Solutions
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate - Market Data Solutions

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This position supports the market data needs for RBC Financial Group globally, including providing solutions and reviewing existing tools (and their associated costs). Market data provides the tools for revenue generation in multiple RBC businesses. For most RBC Enterprise businesses, market data is a critical dependency for revenue generation. Business partners are a demanding group of investment and risk management professionals who depend on timely and accurate market information for effective decision making. The role requires an astute business advisor and diplomat who understands not only the data, but also the business lines being served.

What will you do?

Contract Management

  • Become the global Market Data relationship manager, managing market data related contracts and negotiating best terms during contract reviews/new initiatives with savings and cost avoidance in mind.

Business Engagement

  • Become the key stakeholder to the global RBC Market Data user community, supporting all  platforms on their Market data requirements
  • Collaborate with various internal RBC groups and peers to identify improvements or alternative approaches, and provide leadership on best practices and options on Market Data services

Supplier Management/Vendor Engagement

  • Engage with market data suppliers on a regular basis to review market data requirements, issues, changes, updates, etc.
  • Coordinate meetings or be an escalation point for Market Data Suppliers and the RBC Stakeholders
  • Ensure all market data suppliers adhere to internal supplier management and business continuity requirements; also ensuring all documents and related internal systems are updated accordingly; can involve working with various internal groups (ie Legal, Finance, Functions, etc)

Analytics/Reporting

  • Produce ad-hoc, monthly and quarterly detailed reporting/presentation decks with valued added commentary, analysis and metrics point of escalation/reference for the business line problems

Product Research/Industry Intelligence

  • Seek out sources and solutions for market data strategy per RBC business requirements
  • Research industry trends and provide guidance on alternative solutions or changes impacting market data. Participate in industry working groups to lobby for consistent policies across data provider community
  • Evaluate and review new market data products and providing recommendations on services or solutions for RBC Enterprise

What you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University degree/MBA
  • 5+ years’ experience in a technology/financial services environment
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills
  • Advance proficiency in Excel, Word, and Powerpoint

Nice to-have

  • High level understanding of Market Data tools (MDM, FITS or similar) and control mechanisms (DACS, DART, EMRS) an asset.
  • Data Analysis
  • Reporting/dashboard experience with BI tools. i.e.) Tableau, Qlikview etc.

What will you do?

Our team is the Client Interaction Decision Management (CIDM) team. We are looking for a passionate, energetic and talented data enthusiast to join our team. item.title: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management - GRM
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management - GRM

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

As Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will execute and document validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Wholesale and Retail credit risk systems including risk quantification used in both regulatory and economic capital. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems and parameters validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems including risk quantification validation.

What will you do? 

  • Perform ongoing credit risk systems, including Wholesale criteria paper models, and parameters validation; and provide insightful analysis of validation results

  • Execute and document appropriate quantitative and qualitative tests, review of the logic and conceptual soundness of credit risk rating systems/wholesale criteria paper models/parameters and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, scenario and back testing, benchmarking and

  • Investigate and evaluate data filtering and data quality, relating to credit risk system validation

  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate

  • Review and document compliance with the minimum requirements for the Basel AIRB approach and model policy

  • Keep abreast of advances in credit risk validation analytics

  • Complete ad hoc analytical or empirical projects

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, econometrics, finance or mathematics, and/or a relevant professional qualification

  • Strong knowledge of quantitative validation and vetting techniques

  • Strong computer skills - SAS, SQL and Excel required; Python and MatLab strongly preferred

  • Ability to work with numerous data and IT infrastructures

  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills

Nice-to-have 

  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience

  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset.

  • Works well in teams 

What’s in it for you?  

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Associate Director, Quantitative Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Quantitative Methodology

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Associate Director, Quantitative Methodology is responsible for methodologies related to CCAR capital calculation and Market Risk in equity. This includes model specification, implementation, performance monitoring and maintenance of these methodologies. 

What will you do?

  • Develop and maintain stress testing methodology used for counterparty credit risk in CCAR and ensure methodology compliant with US regulators and RBC Group wide stress testing policies.  This includes the development of counterparty default loss, credit valuation adjustment (CVA) and add-on methodology development and implementation under CCAR stress.
  • Develop and implement methodologies for market risk in equity asset class. This includes, but not limited to, VaR / SVaR approaches and stress testing for internal risk management
  • Provide risk modeling transparency. This is primarily facilitated by the completion of significantly enhanced documentation for the risk models that will satisfy the emerging regulatory expectations (for example, SR-11-7 guidelines published by the Fed).
  • Maintain the existing CCAR CCR models and Market Risk models for equity asset class. This includes ensuring adequate review of the assumptions on an ongoing basis, timely calibration of the models and monitoring of model limitations. This also may include benchmarking against other alternatives, taking appropriate actions as informed from the model performance tracking and/or the independent review performed by the Enterprise Model Risk Management group. Resolve issues raised by internal EMRM team through model validation process and external feedback from regulators on any model deficiencies.
  • Facilitate the annual CCAR run for ongoing regulatory filing
  • Work with CCAR IT, Risk IT, Counterparty Credit Risk and Market Risk teams to implement end-to-end solution for CCAR reporting and market risk reporting

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have 

  • 2+ years of working experience in regulatory & internal risk management requirements under market risk, CCAR or counterparty credit risk
  • Masters in Financial, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent. PhD in Finance, Engineering or Applied Sciences
  • Strong programming skills, such as Python, R with focus on finance use cases
  • Experience or knowledge in machine learning and practice in banking industry and risk management
  • Above average oral and written presentation skills: ability to present clearly complicated modelling concepts and techniques to senior management
  • Broad knowledge across capital market products and business, especially equity and derivative instruments.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in a similar role or risk manager role

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Manager, Business Risk & Controls
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Risk & Controls

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a member of the Business Risk Management team in Cards, Payments & Banking (CPB), in this role, you will be accountable for the effective risk monitoring and governance for the business, providing ongoing oversight of key business risk issues, reporting and administration. You will work closely with the members of the Business Risk team as well as other partners who are leading initiatives and ensures that all work is planned, tracked and reported on regularly and accurately.  You will be responsible for analysis in support of planning and decision management, contributing meaningful insights, stakeholder facilitation and informing sound business decisions

What will you do?

  • Reviews and manages all CPB’s risk reporting, including the Operational Risk Scorecard Risk Appetite, Consolidated Diary Report, Control dashboard

  • Reviews issues and trends in reporting and investigates with appropriate stakeholders to provide recommendations for action to direct manager

  • Helps organize key stakeholders for the Risk Assessment Forum (RAF) for all of CPB and helps manage the overall facilitation of the meeting

  • Build reports and/or provide data queries/analysis in support of operational issues/events, control gaps (ex: anomaly reporting)

  • Develops reports required to support CPB’s Controls Testing by helping to

  • document controls in the Control Inventory, provide status on testing and key control assessments

  • Maintains and updates the Enterprise Product Inventory/Heatmap tool reporting, including product shelf reviews, initiatives and product amendments.

  • Provides ongoing training and support to project/initiatives owners to update the Enterprise Product Inventory/Heatmap tool. Acts as one of the main points of contact for Operational Risk Manager and Group Risk Management on conditions of approval monitoring and provides these groups with regular updates to ensure effective oversight and management.

  • Business Risk Advisor for small to medium size projects. Understands, prioritizes and manages timely and effective resolution of all known risk issues as part of a project/initiative balancing potential impact to business unit and Canadian Banking against business unit strategic imperatives.

  • Assists with Gifts & Entertainment tracking for all of CPB

  • Assist with presentation materials, as required

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Team Administration, reporting and facilitation

  • Understanding of bank policies, systems and processes

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills – Accurately defines root cause and identifies relevant factors. Objectively considers alternatives and anticipates impact of possible solutions. Comfort challenging current practice.

  • Demonstrated ability to take the initiative to solve problems, take ownership and be accountable

  • Collaborative work style and commitment to get the job done in a detail oriented environment

  • Good organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and to work successfully under pressure.

  • Listening, understanding, responding and problem solving

  • Creative thinking

  • Commitment to continuous learning to ensure skills, knowledge, accreditations are up-to-date

  • Microsoft office suite skills; technologically self-sufficient; comfort with new technology; SharePoint, Connect site, etc. set up and administration

  • Experience in a project and status reporting environment.

Nice to have:

  • University Degree or extensive related work experience

  • Experience in a project and status reporting environment.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

item.title: Data Analyst, Advice Centre Data Enablement & Analytic Research
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analyst, Advice Centre Data Enablement & Analytic Research

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team of data engineers, scientists, developers and analysts. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing and detecting trends, reducing risk and providing insights to partners in Advice Centre Leaders & Partners. You will be responsible for collaborating with product leads, data analysts and data scientists to design, launch and iterate on user-centric data insights use cases.

What will you do?

  • Design solutions which deliver data based insights to relevant stakeholders, simplify user experience and address user pain points
  • Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor trends and risk markers using statistics, metrics and models
  • Regularly conduct analytics to identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships with Advice Centre data
  • Collaborate with data engineers to source and understand new and existing data feeds data
  • Regularly test and improve solutions as well as support investigation of data abnormalities
  • Develop, manage and maintain analytical dashboards using Tableau software which provide rich and actionable insights to Advice Centre Leaders, partners and other stakeholders

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 2+ years’ experience in data analytics, SQL, data visualization (Tableau or similar), and Python
  • First-hand experience working with popular Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and notebook environments
  • Qualitative and quantitative experience, and solid experience with understanding users and informing those stories with data
  • Strong understanding of data and statistics
  • Experience with databases and data structures
  • Professional oral and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate between technical and non-technical stakeholders

Nice to have:                                      

  • Undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering or related field
  • Knowledge or experience with detecting external or internal fraud
  • Knowledge of  Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, HDFS, Hive)
  • Experience working on an Agile team

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Manager, AML Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, AML Data Management

Job Description

 

 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?  

The AML Data Management team is mandated to execute the Enterprise AML and Financial Crimes Data Management Program that will govern data used within the enterprise to meet regulatory requirements and expectations, while accommodating RBC’s innovation framework.  You will contribute to sustaining and enhancing the oversight and governance of data used within key processes of the AML and Financial Crimes (such as sanctions screening and transaction monitoring).  You will have an opportunity to liaise with AML Compliance, AML FIU, the Chief Data Office, DNA, and other business partners to execute data management strategies and protocols to maintain and enhance an effective and efficient AML and Financial Crimes Program at RBC.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?  

  • Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries, system documentation, and end user documentation to understand business context and translate into data requirements from an enterprise AML Program perspective
  • Perform data profiling and analysis of data sources to assess data availability and ensure AML data requirements are continually satisfied
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis to measure data quality in accordance with the CDO data quality strategy. Define data quality rules and scorecards for ongoing monitoring and measurement of data quality, particularly from an AML Program perspective
  • Evaluate data quality measurements and scorecards to identify data quality issues that may impact the effectiveness of the AML Program. Leverage enterprise data governance tools to document detailed data lineage and data transformations through liaison between business stakeholders and IT partners
  • Perform post implementation verification to ensure AML data requirements from data sources have been accurately and successfully captured in target data models/schemas
  • Assist with the development of high level plans and user stories for completion of AML data requirements and acceptance phases of projects, improving in the level of detail and accuracy of estimates over time

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have

  • Undergraduate degree coupled with change management experience in complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities
  • 5+ years of technical experience using SQL to interface with various databases, data sources, and file systems (RBDMS, OLTP/OLAP, flat files, UNIX, HDFS)
  • Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts and processes such as Data Quality Controls, Authoritative Data Sources, Master and Reference Data, etc.
  • Proficient with SAS programming and its macro language to perform quantitative data analysis and transformations.  Other expertise with R, Hadoop, VBA, Java and C++  or other related experience desirable
  • Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of reconciliation design, data integration, data sourcing, data quality reporting, and exception resolution processes. As well as knowledge of data warehousing, front-to-back data flows and processing in banking database systems
  • Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers
  • Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
  • Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation or other related certifications

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Bilingual Claims Specialist

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

In this role you will adjudicate and manage Life and waiver claims in a team-oriented, multi-disciplinary, digital environment.  You will be responsible for applying appropriate risk management strategies, which will impact on the company’s financial results, reputation and regulatory risks, client relationships, and business retention.

What will you do? 

• Responsible for the bilingual (French and English) adjudication of claims utilizing a multidisciplinary claim management model to:

- ensure objective, fair and thorough claim adjudication

- comply with practices and procedures and regulatory requirements

- provide the highest level of customer service and manage reputational risk

- develop and implement claims management and return to work strategies on their assigned caseloads where warranted

• Assess, research and analyze numerous contracts, documents the appropriate next steps while effectively and professionally communicating outcomes to our clients

• Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders and business partners using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close

• Resolve minor conflicts and issues and escalates to others as appropriate

What will you need to succeed? 

• Post secondary education

• Minimum 1 year previous Life claims experience

• Strong analytical and decision making skills

• Ability to multitask and balance multiple goals and priorities

• Excellent oral and written communication skills in both English and French

• Demonstrated ability to effectively deal with customers in a manner that is professional with a high degree of customer service

• Ability to effectively manage change

Special Conditions

Please note you must be fluently bilingual in both English and French to apply.  Only applicants fluent in both languages will be considered for this position.

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity
